lead_paragraph: The Tribune Company’s sale of the Cubs may not be completed until midseason or later, the team’s senior vice president said, in part because Wrigley Field must be sold first. The senior vice president, Crane Kenney, told attendees of the team’s fan convention in Chicago that the new Tribune owner, Sam Zell, wanted 94-year-old Wrigley in the hands of the Illinois Sports Facilities Authority before he accepted bids for the Cubs. Kenney said such a move was designed to “bind” the team’s next owner to keeping the Cubs playing at Wrigley.
